question_title: How many wins will the Cleveland Cavaliers have in the 2024-25 NBA basketball season on January 1, 2025?
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Cavaliers Secure Win, Multiple Games Go Down to the Wire in NBA**
The Cleveland Cavaliers secured a win with contributions from Evan Mobley and Caris LeVent, who scored 21 and 19 points respectively. George Niang grabbed 9 rebounds, while Jarrett Allen added 8. In other notable games, Detroit edged out Miami 125-124, Chicago beat Toronto 122-121, and Denver defeated Sacramento 130-129. Philadelphia also won against Charlotte 121-108, and the Clippers defeated Utah Jazz 114-107, the highest score of the season so far. The Eastern Conference leaders are Boston (21-5), New York (16-10), Orlando (17-11), Milwaukee (14-11), and Miami (13-11). In the Western Conference, Oklahoma (20-5) remains in the lead, followed by Memphis (18-9), Houston, and Dallas, all with 17-9, and Denver (14-10).
Original language: es
Publish date: December 17, 2024 01:51 PM
Source:[Prensa latina](https://www.prensa-latina.cu/2024/12/17/cavaliers-maximos-ganadores-en-la-temporada-de-nba/)

**Cleveland Cavaliers Prove Dominance with Thrashing Win over Brooklyn Nets**
The Cleveland Cavaliers demonstrated their dominance in the NBA by defeating the Brooklyn Nets 130-101 on Monday. The Cavs showcased their strength with seven players scoring over 10 points, led by Evan Mobley with 21 points and Caris LeVert with 19 points. This victory solidified the Cavaliers' position as the best team in the NBA, with a record of 23 wins and 4 losses after starting the season with a 15-0 record. The team's performance was impressive, with a 60% success rate in field goal attempts in the first half, leading to a maximum lead of 37 points.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 17, 2024 10:59 AM
Source:[Cooperativa](https://cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/baloncesto/nba/clevaland-cavaliers-dejo-ver-su-gran-nivel-con-arrollador-triunfo-ante/2024-12-17/074548.html)

**Cavaliers Come Back to Smile, 'Escape' from Queta and Company**
The Cleveland Cavaliers returned to winning ways in the NBA, defeating the Brooklyn Nets 101-130 in the early hours of Tuesday morning. They 'escaped' from the Boston Celtics, led by Neemias Queta and his team. The Eastern Conference leaders started strong, leading by more than double in the first quarter (17-37) and extending their lead before halftime (23-35). The game's momentum shifted slightly in the second half, but the Cavaliers ultimately secured a 101-130 victory. With this result, the Cavaliers now have 23 wins and 4 losses in 27 games, surpassing the Boston Celtics, who have 21 wins and 5 losses in 26 games.
Original language: pt
Publish date: December 17, 2024 08:11 AM
Source:[Notícias ao Minuto](https://www.noticiasaominuto.com/desporto/2691392/cavaliers-voltam-a-sorrir-e-fogem-de-neemias-queta-e-companhia)

**Cavaliers vs Nets: Key Matchup in NBA 2024-25 Regular Season**
The Cleveland Cavaliers will face the Brooklyn Nets on December 17 in the NBA 2024-25 regular season. The Cavaliers have won 4 out of their last 5 games, while the Nets have only won 1 out of their last 5. Cavaliers' Donovan Mitchell has been performing well this season, averaging 23.6 points, 4.4 assists, and 4.8 rebounds per game. Meanwhile, Nets' Cam Thomas has been the team's top scorer, averaging 24.7 points, 3.2 rebounds, and 3.4 assists per game. However, the Nets' third-leading scorer Dennis Schroder was traded to the Golden State Warriors, leaving a void in the team's offense. The game will be broadcast on TVBS Sports (緯來體育台) at 8:30 AM and can also be streamed online on ELTA.TV, Hami Video運動館, NBA League Pass, and Line Today.
Original language: zh
Publish date: December 16, 2024 05:14 PM
Source:[NOWnews 今日新聞](https://www.nownews.com/news/6612117)

**Brooklyn Nets vs Cleveland Cavaliers Prediction 12-16-24 NBA Picks**
The Cleveland Cavaliers are predicted to win against the Brooklyn Nets on December 16, 2024, at the Barclays Center. The Cavaliers have a strong record, winning 16 of their last 17 night games against teams with a losing record. The Nets, on the other hand, have lost 8 of their last 9 games against Eastern Conference opponents with a winning record. The article also notes that the Cavaliers have covered the spread in 5 of their last 6 road games against Atlantic Division opponents, while the Nets have failed to cover the spread in 5 of their last 6 night games against Eastern Conference opponents. The author concludes, 'Give me the Cavaliers.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: December 16, 2024 04:15 AM
Source:[sportschatplace.com](https://sportschatplace.com/nba-picks/brooklyn-nets-vs-cleveland-cavaliers-prediction-12-16-24-nba-picks/)

**Cavaliers Look to Extend Winning Streak Against Heat**
The Cleveland Cavaliers will face the Miami Heat at the Kaseya Center with the goal of maintaining their winning streak in the 2024-2025 NBA season. With 21 wins and only three losses, the Cavs are leading the Eastern Conference and have secured four consecutive victories, their best start to a season in over a decade. In their previous game, they defeated the Charlotte Hornets 116-102, with Evan Mobley scoring a personal record 41 points. Meanwhile, the Miami Heat, led by Erik Spoelstra, have won 11 games and lost 10, and are currently in sixth place in the conference. Other notable games include the Washington Wizards' 122-113 win over the Denver Nuggets, the Oklahoma City Thunder's 119-109 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans, and the Dallas Mavericks' 125-118 win over the Toronto Raptors.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 08, 2024 06:17 PM
Source:[labazuca.com](https://labazuca.com/2024/12/08/cavaliers-por-mantener-racha-ganadora-en-la-nba/)

**Cavaliers Look to Extend Winning Streak Against Heat**
The Cleveland Cavaliers, led by Kenny Atkinson, will face the Miami Heat at the Kaseya Center with the goal of maintaining their winning streak in the 2024-2025 NBA season. The Cavs, with 21 wins and only three losses, are on a four-game winning streak and are having their best start to a season in over a decade. In their previous game, they defeated the Charlotte Hornets 116-102, with Evan Mobley scoring a personal high of 41 points. Meanwhile, the Miami Heat, led by Erik Spoelstra, have a 11-10 record and are in sixth place in the standings. Other games in the weekend's schedule saw the Washington Wizards defeat the Denver Nuggets 122-113, the Oklahoma City Thunder beat the New Orleans Pelicans 119-109, and the Dallas Mavericks defeat the Toronto Raptors 125-118.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 08, 2024 03:04 PM
Source:[Prensa latina](https://www.prensa-latina.cu/2024/12/08/cavaliers-por-mantener-racha-ganadora-en-la-nba/)

**Cleveland Cavaliers vs Atlanta Hawks: Cavaliers Expected to Win at Home**
The Cleveland Cavaliers will face the Atlanta Hawks in a crucial matchup in the NBA 2024/25 season. The Cavaliers are currently leading the Eastern Conference and have a strong record, while the Hawks are struggling with 7 wins and 11 losses. The game will take place at the Rocket Mortgage Fieldhouse in Cleveland, with the Cavaliers being the favorites to win. The Cavaliers have a strong offense and defense, led by Donovan Mitchell and Darius Garland, while the Hawks are struggling with injuries and a lack of consistency. Our prediction is that the Cavaliers will win the game, taking advantage of their home court advantage and the Hawks' struggles.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 27, 2024 01:00 PM
Source:[gazetaesportiva.com](https://www.gazetaesportiva.com/apostas/prognosticos/basquete/cleveland-cavaliers-x-atlanta-hawks-nba-27-11-2024)

**Cavaliers' 15-game winning streak ends in loss to Celtics**
The Cleveland Cavaliers started the 2024/2025 season with 15 consecutive wins, the best start in the team's history. However, their winning streak came to an end when they lost to the Boston Celtics 120-117. The Cavaliers had a 21-point lead at one point, but the Celtics managed to come back and win the game. Jayson Tatum led the Celtics with 33 points, 12 rebounds, and 7 assists, while Al Horford added 20 points. Donovan Mitchell scored 35 points for the Cavaliers, but they were unable to overcome their opponents' strong performance. Meanwhile, the San Antonio Spurs, who were missing several key players, pulled off a surprise win over the Oklahoma City Thunder 110-104. Keldon Johnson led the Spurs with 22 points.
Original language: pl
Publish date: November 20, 2024 07:58 AM
Source:[sportowefakty.wp.pl](https://sportowefakty.wp.pl/koszykowka/1157767/15-0-i-koniec-zatrzymali-ich-mistrzowie-nba)

**Boston Celtics end Cleveland Cavaliers' 15-game winning streak in NBA 2024/2025**
The Cleveland Cavaliers' 15-game winning streak in the 2024/2025 NBA season came to an end on Tuesday (19) with a 120-117 loss to the Boston Celtics at the TD Garden. This was the second-best start to a season in NBA history, tied with the Houston Rockets (1993-1994) and the Washington Capitals (1948-1949). The Golden State Warriors' record of 24 consecutive wins to start a season in 2015-2016 remains intact. The highly anticipated matchup was between the first-place team and the vice-leader of the Eastern Conference and current NBA champion, making it a significant game in the early stages of the 2024/2025 NBA season.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 20, 2024 02:52 AM
Source:[uol.com.br](https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/basquete/2024/11/19/boston-celtics-encerra-a-sequencia-invicta-do-cleveland-cavaliers-na-nba.htm)

**Cleveland Cavaliers Start Season with 15 Consecutive Wins**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have started the 2024/25 season with 15 consecutive wins, becoming the fourth team in NBA history to achieve this feat. They defeated Charlotte 128-114, led by Garland's 25 points and 12 rebounds, and Jerome and Mobley's 47 points combined. The team will face Boston in their next match. In other NBA games, Dallas beat Oklahoma City 121-119, with Washington scoring 27 points and 17 rebounds, and Irving adding 23 points. Fontecchio, the only Italian player in the league, returned from injury and scored 6 points in 22 minutes, helping Detroit beat Washington 124-104. Denver lost to Memphis 105-90 without Jokic, while Miami fell to Indiana 119-110 without Butler. New York won the derby against Brooklyn 114-104, led by Towns' double-double and Anunoby's 24 points. Houston defeated Chicago 143-107, with Sengun's triple-double and VanVleet's 28 points.
Original language: it
Publish date: November 18, 2024 12:27 PM
Source:[quotidiano.net](https://sport.quotidiano.net/basket/risultati-nba-c24e05c2)

**Cavaliers win 15th straight game to begin 2024-25 NBA season, joining an elite group**
The Cleveland Cavaliers won their 15th consecutive game to start the 2024-25 NBA season, joining an elite group of only three other teams in NBA history to achieve this feat. They defeated the Charlotte Hornets 128-114 on Sunday, with a strong first half performance, scoring 72 points. This win also marked the Cavs' 8th consecutive home win at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse. The team's next challenge will be a road game against the Boston Celtics on Tuesday, their biggest test yet. Before this season, the Cavs had achieved three 13-game winning streaks under LeBron James' leadership in the 2008-09, 2009-10, and 2017-18 seasons.
Original language: en
Publish date: November 18, 2024 01:39 AM
Source:[The New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5928118/2024/11/17/cleveland-cavaliers-undefeated-streak-feat/)

**Cleveland Cavaliers' Championship Odds Plummet to 15.00**
The Cleveland Cavaliers are leading the Eastern Conference in the NBA. They have started the season with 14 consecutive wins, the longest streak in the team's 55-year history. The odds of Cleveland winning the championship have dropped from 51.00 to 15.00 since the start of the season. Initially, the team was not among the top 10 favorites, but they have now risen to seventh place. Boston remains the main favorite. According to bookmakers, Cleveland's chances for the 2024/25 season are: 1.15 to win the Central Division and 6.50 to win the Eastern Conference.
Original language: ru
Publish date: November 16, 2024 03:59 PM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/betting/1116537025-koefficzient-na-chempionstvo-klivlenda-obvalilsya-s-51-00-do-15-00-s-n.html)

**Cleveland Cavaliers Set Franchise Record with 14-0 Start**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have started the 2024/25 NBA season with a 14-0 record, setting a new franchise record for consecutive wins. This surpasses the previous record of 13 consecutive wins set by the Cavs in the 2008/09, 2009/10, and 2017/18 seasons under LeBron James. According to coach Kenny Atkinson, the team's success is due to their high-intensity gameplay, many possessions, and good shooting opportunities for all players. Atkinson, who previously worked with Steve Kerr in Golden State, is having a successful debut season in Cleveland, equaling Lawrence Frank's record for most consecutive wins by a debutant coach (14). The team's next challenge is to face the Hornets on Sunday, followed by a crucial game against the Celtics on Tuesday. If they can maintain their winning streak, they will be in a strong position to challenge the Golden State Warriors' record of 73-9, set in the 2015/16 season.
Original language: es
Publish date: November 16, 2024 10:35 AM
Source:[Mundo Deportivo](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/baloncesto/nba/20241116/1002354048/cleveland-superan-record-lebron-ritmo-mejores-warriors.html)

**Cleveland Cavaliers Extend Winning Streak to 14 Games**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have extended their winning streak to 14 games, defeating the Chicago Bulls 144-126 in the NBA Cup. They remain the only team in the 2024/2025 season to have not lost a game. The Cavaliers' 37-point scorer and 29-rebounder had a standout performance. The Bulls hit 20 of 42 three-pointers, but the Cavaliers were also impressive in this area, making 21 of 43. The Cavaliers have become the sixth team in NBA history to start a season with 14 consecutive wins, a record previously held by the Golden State Warriors, who began the 2015/2016 season with a 24-0 record. In another game, the New York Knicks defeated the Brooklyn Nets 124-122, with Jalen Brunson scoring 37 points and Mikal Bridges blocking a crucial shot by Dennis Schroder. 'It was a great day,' said no one, as the Knicks secured their second win in the NBA Cup.
Original language: pl
Publish date: November 16, 2024 07:21 AM
Source:[sportowefakty.wp.pl](https://sportowefakty.wp.pl/koszykowka/1156850/ale-derby-szalony-mecz-w-nowym-jorku-cleveland-cavaliers-srubuja-rekord)

**Philadelphia 76ers x Cleveland Cavaliers: Cavaliers favored to win**
The Philadelphia 76ers will face the Cleveland Cavaliers in the 11th round of the 2024/25 NBA regular season. The game will take place on Wednesday, November 13, at 21:30 (Brasília time) at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia. The 76ers have a 11-6 advantage in their 17 meetings, with 3 wins in their last 5 games. However, the Cavaliers are favorites to win, having won 12 of their 12 games so far this season. The 76ers are struggling, having won only 2 of their 9 games, and will be without key players Kyle Lowry, Kenyon Martin Jr, Robert Covington, and Joel Embiid. The Cavaliers will also be without their top scorer, Donovan Mitchell, but will rely on Darius Garland to lead the team. Our prediction is for the Cleveland Cavaliers to win.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 13, 2024 12:30 PM
Source:[gazetaesportiva.com](https://www.gazetaesportiva.com/apostas/prognosticos/basquete/philadelphia-76ers-x-cleveland-cavaliers-nba-13-11-2024)

**Cavaliers' hot start continues as team improves to 12-0 with win over Bulls**
The Cleveland Cavaliers continued their impressive start to the 2024-25 season with a 119-113 win over the Bulls, improving their record to 12-0. This achievement makes them the eighth team in NBA history to win their first 12 games. Cavaliers guard Donovan Mitchell led all scorers with 36 points, including 7-of-16 from three-point range, and also had eight rebounds, two assists, and four steals. The team's defense played a key role in the win, forcing 21 turnovers that turned into 35 points. According to NBC Los Angeles, the previous seven teams that began a season at least 12-0 reached the playoffs, with five of them reaching the NBA Finals.
Original language: en
Publish date: November 12, 2024 04:41 AM
Source:[yardbarker.com](https://www.yardbarker.com/nba/articles/cavaliers_hot_start_continues_as_team_improves_to_12_0_with_win_over_bulls/s1_13132_41217495)

**When Will The Cleveland Cavaliers Lose A Basketball Game?**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have started the 2024-25 NBA season with an undefeated record of 11-0, surpassing their projected playoff expectations. They have defeated teams such as the Lakers by 24 points and the Warriors by 19 points. Their point differential is +12.5, the second-best in the league, and they are averaging 122.7 points per game, the most in the NBA. Their next four opponents do not have a winning record, and they will face the Boston Celtics, last year's NBA Finals Champions, on November 19th. The Cavaliers are tied for the 8th best start to an NBA season, and they would tie the second-best mark in league history with 15 straight wins.
Original language: en
Publish date: November 10, 2024 02:14 PM
Source:[sportscasting.com](https://www.sportscasting.com/news/when-will-the-cleveland-cavaliers-lose-a-basketball-game/)

**Cavaliers Continue Perfect Start with 11th Consecutive Win**
The Cleveland Cavaliers continued their perfect start to the season, defeating the Brooklyn Nets 105-100 on Saturday night. This was their 11th consecutive win, making them undefeated in the 2024/2025 NBA season. Although they failed to reach 110 points for the first time this season, the Cavaliers showed their ability to come back in the final period, when they were down by 12 points. Evan Mobley led the team with a double-double of 23 points and 16 rebounds, while Donovan Mitchell and Darius Garland added 22 and 20 points respectively. For the Nets, Cameron Johnson was the top scorer with 23 points, followed closely by Cam Thomas and Dennis Schröder with 22 points each. The Cavaliers are only the 12th team in NBA history to start with 11 wins and no losses, and they currently lead the Eastern Conference, while the Nets are in sixth place with four wins and six losses.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 10, 2024 04:38 AM
Source:[globo.com](https://ge.globo.com/basquete/nba/noticia/2024/11/10/nba-cavaliers-vencem-os-nets-vao-a-11-vitorias-e-continuam-com-temporada-perfeita.ghtml)

**Cavaliers Reach 10 Consecutive Wins, Remain Undefeated in 2024/2025 Season**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have won 10 consecutive games, with a 136-117 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Friday. This achievement marks the team's first 10-game winning streak, with no losses in the 2024/2025 season. The Cavaliers are the only undefeated team in the NBA and lead the Eastern Conference. According to the NBA, since 2000, only four teams have achieved a 10-game winning streak at the start of the season: the Golden State Warriors (2015/16), Dallas Mavericks (2002/03), and Philadelphia 76ers (2000/01). However, the current Cavaliers team is the only one to have scored at least 110 points in all games. The team also set a franchise record for the most points scored in the first half, with 83 points in the first 24 minutes. Darius Garland led the team with 27 points, while Evan Mobley and Ty Jerome also scored over 20 points each. The Cavaliers will face the Brooklyn Nets on Saturday at 21:30, while the Warriors will play the Oklahoma City Thunder on Sunday at 21:00.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 09, 2024 01:03 PM
Source:[globo.com](https://ge.globo.com/basquete/nba/noticia/2024/11/09/nba-cavaliers-chegam-a-10-vitorias-e-nenhuma-derrota-na-temporada.ghtml)

**Ballin’!: 9 Cavs Facts For 9 Cavs Wins To Start The Season**
The Cleveland Cavaliers are off to a historic start, with a 9-game winning streak to begin the 2024/25 NBA season. They are the only undefeated team in the league and sit atop the Eastern Conference standings. Under the guidance of new head coach Kenny Atkinson, the team has shown impressive performances from players such as Donovan Mitchell, Evan Mobley, and Darius Garland. The bench has also been a bright spot, led by Caris Levert, Ty Jerome, and Sam Merrill. The team's success may also be attributed to the weakness of the Eastern Conference, with only two teams currently holding winning records. The Cavaliers will look to continue their winning ways at home, where they have yet to lose a game this season.
Original language: en
Publish date: November 07, 2024 11:33 PM
Source:[wiznation.com](https://wiznation.com/playlist/ballin-9-cavs-facts-for-9-cavs-wins-to-start-the-season/)

**Cleveland Cavaliers Start Season with Historic 9-0 Record**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have started the 2024-25 NBA season with a dream run, achieving a record of 9-0, the best start in franchise history. Their latest win was against the New Orleans Pelicans, with Donovan Mitchell scoring 29 points, supported by Caris LeVert and Jarrett Allen, both with 16 points. The team's impressive start has generated excitement among fans and experts, who see the Cavaliers as a potential contender. Coach Kenny Atkinson, who joined the team during the summer, has played a key role in this success, bringing a new mentality and winning strategies. According to Mitchell, the team must maintain consistency and build on this positive momentum. Despite the impressive start, challenges lie ahead, including matches against tough opponents like the Golden State Warriors and Brooklyn Nets. The team will need to demonstrate focus and determination to continue winning.

**Cavaliers Extend Winning Streak to Nine Games**
The Cleveland Cavaliers continue their dominant campaign in the 2024/25 NBA season, securing their ninth consecutive win against the New Orleans Pelicans with a score of 131-122. Donovan Mitchell was the standout player for the Cavs, scoring 29 points, matching the performance of Zion Williamson, the highlight of the Pelicans. This streak of wins without a loss is a testament to the team's strength. In a separate NBA game, the Golden State Warriors defeated the Boston Celtics 118-112 in a re-match of the 2021/22 season finals. Stephen Curry had an impressive performance, scoring 27 points, grabbing 7 rebounds, and providing 9 assists.
Original language: pt
Publish date: November 07, 2024 11:46 AM
Source:[uol.com.br](https://www.uol.com.br/esporte/futebol/ultimas-noticias/gazeta-esportiva/2024/11/07/resultados-da-nba-cavaliers-chegam-a-nona-vitoria-seguida.htm)

**Cavaliers' Eight-Game Winning Streak: A Rare Achievement in NBA History**
The Cleveland Cavaliers have won their eighth consecutive game at the start of the 2024/2025 NBA season, defeating the Milwaukee Bucks 116:114. This is the first time since the 2007/2008 season that a team has achieved eight consecutive wins at the start of the season. In that season, the Boston Celtics, led by Kevin Garnett, Ray Allen, and Paul Pierce, went on to win the championship. The Cavaliers' winning streak was last achieved by the Celtics, who were defeated in their ninth game of the season by the Orlando Magic. The Cavaliers will face the New Orleans Pelicans in their next game. The Cavaliers have only won one NBA championship in their history, in the 2015/2016 season with LeBron James on the team.
Original language: ru
Publish date: November 05, 2024 06:02 PM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/basketball/news-5775344-najdena-zakonomernost-v-kolichestve-pobed-na-starte-sezona-i-shansah-na-titul.html)

**Lillard and Giannis' 75 Points Not Enough as Bucks Fall to Cavaliers**
Damian Lillard and Giannis Antetokounmpo combined for 75 points, but it wasn't enough for the Milwaukee Bucks to end their losing streak. The Bucks led by 16 points, but the Cleveland Cavaliers came back to win 114-113 on a last-second shot. This is the Bucks' fifth consecutive loss in the 2024/2025 season. The Cavaliers, on the other hand, have won seven of their first seven games and are one win away from tying the best start in franchise history. Lillard scored 41 points, including 10 three-pointers, while Antetokounmpo had a double-double with 34 points and 16 rebounds. Despite the stars' efforts, the Bucks' poor performance puts coach Doc Rivers' job in jeopardy. The team, considered a playoff favorite, is 14th in the Eastern Conference with one win and five losses. Donovan Mitchell was the star of the game for the Cavaliers, scoring 30 points, including the two that sealed the win. The Cavaliers are one of the only undefeated teams in the 2024/2025 NBA season, with seven wins.
